intro: Hedyotis leuserensis, commonly known as the Leuser Valley geranium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Hedyotis leuserensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
